alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Swisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 03 at 10:56PM CDT until June 03 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT FOR EASTERN SWISHER AND BRISCOE COUNTIES... At 1055 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles north of Silverton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Silverton, Caprock Canyon State Park, Quitaque, Vigo Park, Mackenzie Reservoir and Claytonville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
